thread.title: Google and DJUBO announce commission partnership for hotel bookings
thread.title_full: Google and DJUBO announce commission partnership for hotel bookings - The Economic Times

author: Anumeha Chaturvedi
title: Google and DJUBO announce commission partnership for hotel bookings
text:
NEW DELHI: DJUBO , a cloud based SAAS product company for hotels and Google have partnered to increase the share of direct bookings for hotels through a product called FIREBALL . 

DJUBO has entered into a premium partnership with Google for a commission based partnership, the company said in a statement. DJUBO is the only hotel tech company in India which has entered into such a partnership with Google, the company added. Google will be giving a high visibility to DJUBO's client hotels in exchange for a commission for Google on successful bookings. 

So far, Google was only entering into cost-per-click partnerships with other hotel tech companies which required hotels or their tech partners to pay Google for every click that lands visitors on the hotel's booking engine. 

All clients of DJUBO will get immediate visibility for their direct booking engine across all Google platforms like Google Hotels, Google Maps, Google Business Listing etc and will be charged a commission only when a booking happens. Google will use their unique algorithms and artificial intelligence tools to handle the bidding. 

Sankalp Goel, co-founder and director, DJUBO said: "One of DJUBO's goals is to increase direct bookings for hotels at lower than OTA commission rates. Traditionally direct booking platforms for hotels like brand websites, booking engines and enquiry CRM tools contribute to 1% of bookings in India which DJUBO has been able to pull close to 7% already through on page SEO, price comparison widget, mobile friendly website templates and other partnerships. With the launch of Fireball we are hoping to increase the penetration of direct bookings further."
